questions.question: A body radiates heat at the rate of 4 cal/m2/s, when its temperature is 227°C. what is the heat radiated by the same body when its temperature is 727°C

explanations.a: The right answer is (c). We know that the Power radiated is directly proportional to temperature to the power of 4. So, T1 = 227°C = 500K, T2 = 727°C = 1000K and P1 = 4 cal/m2/s. P2/P1 = (1000/500)^4. P2 = 64 cal/m2/s.
